page.title: 03Housing
page.content: Of the 48 houses in LINDEAN all but 4 are privately owned.The exceptions are a block of 4 "Cruden" houses built in 1949 by the local authority as accommodation for agricultural workers employed on neighbouring farms,today none are so used. The privately owned houses cover a wide range of architectural styles and dates.They include a "baronial-type" mansion built about 1850, two attractive and well-sited estate/ farm houses,three substantial farmhouses, a short row of combined cottages-and -workshops,now "protected", a scatter of farm cottages attached to farms , and a wider scatter of unpretentious houses built by the board of agriculture in 1913 (p.12).The former school and schoolhouse , the disused cornmill and an "outby" shepherd's cottage have been converted.
